     <div id="contentcenter" style="width:758px;padding-left:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:8px; float:left;">
      <div id="centerboxes">
       <div id="wrapbox17114948">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="17114948">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title17114948">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Selecting Children's Books
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content17114948">
          <p>
           <strong>
            AWARD WINNERS
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            <em>
             <strong>
              Required for the assignment
             </strong>
            </em>
           </p>
           <p>
            Caldecott Medal Winners and Honor Books
            <br />
            <a href="http://www.ala.org/alsc/awardsgrants/bookmedia/caldecottmedal/caldecottmedal">
             http://www.ala.org/alsc/awardsgrants/bookmedia/caldecottmedal/caldecottmedal
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            Coretta Scott King Book Awards
            <br />
            <a href="http://www.ala.org/emiert/cskbookawards">
             http://www.ala.org/emiert/cskbookawards
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            Michael L. Printz Award for Excellence in Young Adult Literature
            <br />
            <a href="http://www.ala.org/yalsa/printz/">
             http://www.ala.org/yalsa/printz/
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            Newbery Medal and Honor Books
            <br />
            <a href="http://www.ala.org/alsc/awardsgrants/bookmedia/newberymedal/newberymedal">
             http://www.ala.org/alsc/awardsgrants/bookmedia/newberymedal/newberymedal
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            Orbis Pictus Nonfiction Award
            <br />
            <a href="http://www.ncte.org/awards/orbispictus">
             http://www.ncte.org/awards/orbispictus
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            Pura Belpr&eacute; Medal
            <br />
            <a href="http://www.ala.org/alsc/awardsgrants/bookmedia/belpremedal">
             http://www.ala.org/alsc/awardsgrants/bookmedia/belpremedal
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            Scott O'Dell Award
            <br />
            <a href="http://www.scottodell.com/Pages/ScottO%27DellAwardforHistoricalFiction.aspx">
             http://www.scottodell.com/Pages/ScottO%27DellAwardforHistoricalFiction.aspx
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            <strong>
             <em>
              Other
             </em>
            </strong>
           </p>
           <p>
            International Literacy Association: Choices Booklists
            <br />
            <a href="http://www.literacyworldwide.org/get-resources/reading-lists">
             http://www.literacyworldwide.org/get-resources/reading-lists
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            Laura Ingalls Wilder Medal
            <br />
            <a href="http://www.ala.org/alsc/awardsgrants/bookmedia/wildermedal/wilderabout">
             http://www.ala.org/alsc/awardsgrants/bookmedia/wildermedal/wilderabout
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            Mildred L. Batchelder Award
            <br />
            <a href="http://www.ala.org/alsc/awardsgrants/bookmedia/batchelderaward">
             http://www.ala.org/alsc/awardsgrants/bookmedia/batchelderaward
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            Robert F. Sibert Medal
            <br />
            <a href="http://www.ala.org/alsc/awardsgrants/bookmedia/sibertmedal">
             http://www.ala.org/alsc/awardsgrants/bookmedia/sibertmedal
            </a>
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            BANNED / CHALLENGED BOOKS
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            Challenged Children's Books (University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign)
            <br />
            <a href="http://www.library.illinois.edu/sshel/s-coll/findbks/addlbibs/challengedbooks/index.htm">
             http://www.library.illinois.edu/sshel/s-coll/findbks/addlbibs/challengedbooks/index.htm
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            Frequently Challenged Books of the 21st Century (American Library Association)
            <br />
            <a href="http://www.ala.org/bbooks/frequentlychallengedbooks">
             http://www.ala.org/bbooks/frequentlychallengedbooks
            </a>
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            GENERAL GUIDES ON CHILDREN'S BOOKS
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            <strong>
             A to Zoo: Subject Access to Children's Picture Books
            </strong>
            <br />
            Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 028.5 L732a
           </p>
           <p>
            <strong>
             Best Books for Children: Preschool through Grade 6
            </strong>
            <br />
            Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 028.5 G478b
           </p>
           <p>
            <strong>
             Children's Catalog
            </strong>
            <br />
            Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 011.62 C536
           </p>
           <p>
            <strong>
             Children &amp; Books
            </strong>
            <br />
            Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 028.5 A667c
           </p>
           <p>
            <strong>
             Using Picture Storybooks to Teach Literary Devices: Recommended Books for Children and Young Adults
            </strong>
            <br />
            Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 028.5 H179u
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            SUBJECT AND GENRE SPECIFIC BOOKS
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            <strong>
             Across Cultures: A Guide to Multicultural Literature for
            </strong>
            <strong>
             C
            </strong>
            <strong>
             hildren
             <br />
            </strong>
            Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 028.5 E13a
           </p>
           <p>
            <strong>
             Adventuring with Books: A Booklist for Pre-K - Grade 6
            </strong>
            <br />
            Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 028.5 N277a
           </p>
           <p>
            <strong>
             Fantasy Literature for Children and Young Adults
            </strong>
            <br />
            Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 028.5 G259f
           </p>
           <p>
            <strong>
             Graphic Novels (University of Wisconsin, Madison)
            </strong>
            <br />
            <a href="http://www.education.wisc.edu/ccbc/books/graphicnovels.asp">
             http://www.education.wisc.edu/ccbc/books/graphicnovels.asp
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            <strong>
             Great Graphic Novels for Teens (Young Adult Library Services Association)
            </strong>
            <br />
            <a href="http://www.ala.org/yalsa/ggnt">
             http://www.ala.org/yalsa/ggnt
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            <strong>
             Green Reads: Best Environmental Resources for Youth, K-12
            </strong>
            <br />
            Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 016.33372 W515g
           </p>
           <p>
            <strong>
             Kaleidoscope: A Multicultural Booklist for Grades K-8
            </strong>
            <br />
            Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 028.5 B272k
           </p>
           <p>
            <strong>
             Science Fiction, Fantasy, and Horror Writers
            </strong>
            <br />
            Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 028.5 M169s v.1-2
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <div id="boxatt17114948" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">
            <ul>
            </ul>
            &nbsp;&nbsp;
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox17114950">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="17114950">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title17114950">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Finding Reviews of Children's Books: Indexes &amp; Databases
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content17114950">
          <p>
           <strong>
            PRINT INDEXES AND SOURCES
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            The following sources provide citations for reviews of children's books:
           </p>
           <p>
            <strong>
             Book Review Digest
            </strong>
            <br />
            Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 015.73 B724d
           </p>
           <p>
            <strong>
             Book Review Index
            </strong>
            <br />
            Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 015.73 B724i
           </p>
           <p>
            <strong>
             Children's Literature Review
            </strong>
            <br />
            Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 028.5 C536
           </p>
           <p>
            <strong>
             Reader's Guide to Periodical Literature
            </strong>
            <br />
            Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 051 R286g
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <b>
            INTERDISCIPLINARY DATABASES
           </b>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.asp?profile=ehost&amp;defaultdb=aph" target="new">
             Academic Search Complete
            </a>
            <br />
            This is a general, interdisciplinary database that contains full-text and/or indexing of several of the journals that contain reviews of children's books. To find these search for the title of the book or the author's name (last name first) as a subject or word.
           </p>
           <p>
            <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/">
             Encompass Search
            </a>
            <br />
            Encompass Search finds information by searching through a massive collection of books, scholarly journals, newspapers and magazines, dissertations, conference proceedings, music, video, maps, and more. Rather than searching in separate databases, Encompass Search helps you find resources from many catalogs and databases quickly and easily, all from a single search box.&nbsp;
           </p>
           <p>
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://www.lexisnexis.com/hottopics/lnacademic" target="new">
             LexisNexis Academic
            </a>
            <br />
            A news database that includes book reviews. 1980s to present.
           </p>
           <p>
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.asp?profile=ehost&amp;defaultdb=ofm" target="new">
             OmniFile
            </a>
            <br />
            This database includes an electronic version of the Reader's Guide, but is linked to several other databases by the same producer. Search for the title of the book or the author's name (last name first) as a subject or as a word.
           </p>
           <p>
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.asp?profile=ehost&amp;defaultdb=rgr">
             Readers' Guide Retrospective
            </a>
            <br />
            Provides indexing of general-interest periodicals published in the United States for the period 1890-1982.
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <div id="boxatt17114950" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">
            <ul>
            </ul>
            &nbsp;&nbsp;
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox18453766">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18453766">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18453766">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Getting the Full Text of Articles
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content10536644">
          <p>
           To get the full text of an article, consider the following options:
          </p>
          <p>
           - If you are in Encompass Search or a library database, look for "Check for Full Text buttons," "Access Online," or "Check eResources" buttons. These buttons will take you the full text of the article or tell you that the full text cannot be found. If the full text is not available from Trexler Library, look for buttons to request the item from another library via interlibrary loan. Or go directly to the
           <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/services/interlibrary-loan.html">
            interlibrary loan
           </a>
           request forms.
          </p>
          <p>
           - If you have citation information for the article (i.e., journal title, article title, publication year, etc.), type the information about your article in
           <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/">
            Encompass Search
           </a>
           on the library website. If the library subscribes to the full text, you will be directed to the article (see first bullet above). If not, you can request a copy of the article via
           <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/services/interlibrary-loan.html">
            interlibrary loan
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           - If Trexler Library does not have access to the full text of the article, search
           <a href="http://www.google.com/scholar">
            Google Scholar
           </a>
           by article title to see if the author has made a copy freely available online. If not, you can request a copy of the article via
           <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/services/interlibrary-loan.html">
            interlibrary loan
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt10536644" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox17114975">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="17114975">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title17114975">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Researching Children's Book Authors
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content17114975">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Yesterday's Authors of Books for Children: Facts and Pictures about Authors and Illustrators of Books for Young People, from Early Times to 1960
           </strong>
           <br />
           Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 028.5 Y47 v.1-2
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Major Authors and Illustrators for Children and Young Adults: A Selection of Sketches from Something about the Author
           </strong>
           <br />
           Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 028.520922 M234a
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Science Fiction, Fantasy, and Horror Writers
           </strong>
           <br />
           Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 028.5 M169s v.1-2
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Black Authors &amp; Illustrators of Children's Books: A Biographical Dictionary
           </strong>
           <br />
           Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 028.5092 B692b
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Children's Books and Their Creators: An Invitation to the Feast of Twentieth-Century Children's Literature
           </strong>
           <br />
           Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 028.5 S587c
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Something About the Author
            <br />
           </strong>
           Online: Search Encompass Search by title or
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://infotrac.galegroup.com/itweb/mul_coll?db=SATA">
            http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://infotrac.galegroup.com/itweb/mul_coll?db=SATA
           </a>
           <br />
           Print Location: Main Collection (Ref.) 028.520922 S696a
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt17114975" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">
            <ul>
            </ul>
            &nbsp;&nbsp;
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox17114983">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="17114983">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title17114983">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Finding Lesson Plans
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content17114983">
          <p>
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.asp?profile=ehost&amp;defaultdb=eric" target="new">
            ERIC
           </a>
           <br />
           Use this education database to find lesson plan ideas using your children's book.
          </p>
          <p>
           <a href="http://www.carolhurst.com/">
            Carol Hurst
           </a>
           <br />
           A personal website with recommended activities for featured books. See "Featured Books" under "Children's Books."
          </p>
          <p>
           <a href="http://www.nea.org/tools/LessonPlans.html">
            NEA Lesson Plans
           </a>
           <br />
           Lesson plans from the National Education Association.
          </p>
          <p>
           <a href="http://www.readwritethink.org">
            ReadWriteThink
           </a>
           <br />
           <span class="st">
            "Providing educators and students access to the highest quality practices and resources in
            <em>
             reading
            </em>
            and language arts instruction.
           </span>
           "
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt17114983" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">
            <ul>
            </ul>
            &nbsp;&nbsp;
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div id="contentright" style="width:209px;float:left; padding-right:0px;">
      <div id="profile4651682" class="profile_wrapper">
      </div>
      <div id="rightboxes">
       <div id="wrapbox18453772">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18453772">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18453772">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Need Help with Your Research?
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content17117745">
          <p>
           <em>
            Contact:
           </em>
          </p>
          <p>
           <b>
            Jen Jarson
           </b>
           <br />
           Social Sciences Reference Librarian
           <br />
           phone: 484-664-3552
           <br />
           email: jarson@muhlenberg.edu
           <br />
          </p>
          <p>
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt17117745" class="boxatt">
